name: Harish Krishnamurthy
body:
## About Me

I hail from the [Royal City of Mysore](http://royalmaisur.com), India and currently live and work in the Boston area. I enjoy solving Machine Learning/Artificial Intelligence problems. I graduated with a Masters from [Communication and Digital Signal Processing](http://cdsp.neu.edu) from Northeastern Univeristy, Boston. My [thesis](http://iris.lib.neu.edu/cgi/viewcontent.cgi?article=1023&context=elec_comp_theses) was in Speech Recognition at BBN Technologies, Cambridge. Later I interned at Mitsubishi Electric Research Labs in Data Analytics and Speech. 

## Papers
* ”Generating Facies Probability Cubes” - US Patent filed, March 2010

* Harish K Krishnamurthy, Study of algorithms to combine multiple automatic speech recogni- tion(ASR)system outputs, Master’s thesis, [pdf], Northeastern University, Boston MA 02115, April 2009.

* Harish Krishnamurthy, Spyros Matsoukas, John Makhoul. - Combining multiple speech outputs by extending Bayesian combination (BAYCOM) for word recognition. CDSP workshop, North- eastern University. March 2009.

* Luz Angelica Caudillo Mata, Harish K.K, Sadia Mwangangi, George Price, and Hugo Rodrguez Ordonez, A probabilistic model of cancer cell survival rates given arbitrary drug combinations, Proceedings of the Twelfth PIMS Industrial Problems Solving Workshop, PIMS IPSW 12,[pdf], (2008).

* Harish K.K, Bansilal, and P A Koushik, Hybrid neural network architecture for age identification of ancient kannada scripts, Circuits and Systems, 2003, ISCAS 2003 Proceedings of the 2003 International Symposium on Circuits and Systems (Portions published in the book chapter of ”Computational Intelligence in Archaelogy”),[pdf], 5 (2003), no. V, 661–664.

* Harish K.K and U.J. Shenoy, Classification of power system faults using wavelet transforms and probabilistic neural networks, Circuits and Systems, 2003, ISCAS 2003 Proceedings of the 2003 International Symposium on Circuits and Systems,[pdf], 3 (2003), no. V, 423–426.

* A probabilistic model of cancer cell survival rates given arbitrary drug combinations. Pacific Institute of Mathematical Sciences, June 2008, Proceedings of the 12th PIMS Industrial prob- lem solving workshop, Regina, Canada.

* Classification of Power system faults using Wavelet transforms and Probabilistic Neural Net- work., Proceedings of the 2003 IEEE Symposium on Circuits and Systems, ISCAS 2003.
